episodes.title: No More Kids In Scientology: Is Justice Possible? #NMKIS
episodes.description:
No More Kids in Scientology: A Legal Conversation with attorneys from Andrews & Thornton

Cinco de Mayo isn’t just about celebration—it’s about resistance.

It marks the day in 1862 when a small, outnumbered Mexican force stood up to a much stronger one and said: Not today.

That spirit matters here too.

On May 5, I’m hosting a live conversation about something I’ve fought for my whole life: protecting kids from what we went through in Scientology. 

We’ll talk with attorneys about what survivors can do—legally, safely, and confidentially.

This isn’t just a livestream.

It’s part of the same message:
We’re done being outnumbered. 
We’re done being silent.

This Cinco de Mayo, we take a stand for all kids growing up in Scientology with no advocates. 

I’ve spent over a decade since I left Scientology speaking out about the harm that happened to kids raised in Scientology—because I was one of them. 

Children cannot consent to be subjected to coercive control, trauma, or abuse.

And too many of us experienced all three growing up inside that system.

This conversation is personal.
It’s also an important public discussion.

I’m hosting a live segment with attorney Ann Andrews, Kimberly DeGonia from the law firm Andrews & Thornton, and advocate Mona, to talk about the legal landscape around childhood abuse connected to what we experienced growing up in  Scientology.

This is not legal advice. 

This live is meant to inform, support, and help survivors understand what legal rights and protections may exist—especially in California, where recent laws have created more space for justice.

Topics we’ll cover:
 • How survivors of childhood abuse in groups like Scientology may seek legal recourse
 • What a trauma-informed legal process looks like
 • How confidentiality works when speaking with an attorney
 • What current California laws allow in terms of civil or criminal actions
 • What emotional and practical support survivors may need when coming forward

This is a safe, public, survivor-led conversation with legal professionals.
 No pressure. 
No expectation. 

Just information, compassion, and clarity.

Disclaimer: This live segment is for informational purposes only. Nothing discussed should be considered legal advice, nor does participation create an attorney-client relationship.

#ScientologySurvivor #NoMoreKidsInScientology #ReligiousAbuseAwareness #LegalRights #SurvivorSupport #ChildhoodAbuse #CaliforniaLaw #TraumaInformedLaw

episodes.description:
Title: The Weight of Innocence: Children Are Not Miniature Adults

In the bewildering landscape of Scientology, one recurring fallacy reigns supreme - the notion that children are just miniature adults. This fundamental misunderstanding underpins the cult's dark practices and serves as the rationale for the unconscionable choices made by its members. It's essential to underscore that minors cannot give informed consent to the practices the adults in Scientology willingly subject themselves to.

The cult's predictable programming extends to the children who are raised within its confines. In their distorted worldview, children are expected to mirror the behavior of the adults, partaking in practices that would be unimaginable in a rational society. This notion that they are simply "small adults" leads to an unfathomable cascade of injustices.

Yet, this framework fails to recognize a fundamental truth – children are not miniature adults. Their innocence, vulnerability, and lack of life experience distinguish them as a unique category deserving of utmost protection. It is a sardonic twist of fate that within Scientology, this very innocence is exploited, their consent assumed in a world where their voices are overpowered by those who should know better.

Today, we raise our voices in protest, echoing the imperative that children are not miniaturized versions of adults. They cannot, by any moral or ethical standard, give informed consent to the absurdities of Scientology. It is a clarion call for change, a demand for a reevaluation of values, and a plea for the protection of the most vulnerable among us. For children are not miniature adults, but bearers of innocence, worthy of our utmost care and safeguarding.

#Protest #ChildTraffickingMustStop

episodes.title: Ashton Kutcher "Thorn" anti- trafficking of kids 501c a Scam?
episodes.description:
"We need your help, every single dollar that we raise is going to go towards building software tools so that kids being abused today will someday have the chance to just be kids," explained Ashton Kutcher. 

It's truly a noble cause, isn't it? Here's a man who appears to be passionately advocating for the protection of children, claiming to have met countless victims of sexual abuse, and expressing deep empathy for their heartbreaking experiences. What a commendable stance to take!

But wait, let's take a closer look at the perplexing paradox that is Ashton Kutcher's involvement. While he champions the cause of abused children, he's also known to have had a front-row seat to the inner workings of the Celebrity Centre and the Manor Hotel, both owned and operated by the Church of Scientology. These institutions, as we well know, have a less-than-stellar track record when it comes to appropriate interactions with minors - speaking from first hand experience. 

To add to the puzzlement, Kutcher's best buddy, Danny Masterson, stands as a convicted serial rapist. Astonishingly, Kutcher has publicly extolled Masterson's moral character post his conviction. It begs the question: How can one advocate for victims of sexual abuse on one hand, and on the other, support a convicted serial rapist who was a so called "close" friend?

And then there's the matter of Kutcher's role as the chairman of the board of the Thorne organization – a multi-million-dollar 501(c) organization supposedly committed to combating child abuse. One can't help but wonder how these connections align. Thorne, after all, has actively sought substantial funding from Congress, but its leadership appears to be in the hands of someone so astonishingly tone-deaf that it boggles the mind especially when the so called "chairman of the board" of over a decade "steps down" when this facade is brought to question - why step down when he could so easily STEP UP? 

When are any of these 501(c) organizations ever going to experience any real transparency about what they are actually doing? It seems like a perpetual cycle of rhetoric without accountability, a grand performance without substance. 

 It's giving "saying one thing and doing another" 

Perhaps it's time for some real soul-searching and consistency in your actions and affiliations.

Join us with @nocultyvibes as we delve into the weeds of the shady world of 501(c) so-called child protection organizations that seem to not be making a shred of sense.

#ChildProtection #Advocacy #Hypocrisy #ChildAbuse #AshtonKutcher #DannyMasterson #ThorneOrganization #Transparency #RhetoricWithoutAccountability #NoCultVibes

episodes.title: Will Danny Masterson Plead the 5th?
episodes.description:
Statement: 
Today, we bear witness to a bewildering hypocrisy within the world of Scientology – a so-called "belief system" that, on one hand, encourages its members to divulge their deepest secrets and actively self-incriminate through what they dub as "security checks." 

Yet, on the other hand,  they are advising their "in-good-standing" member, convicted felon Danny Masterson, to consider invoking the fifth amendment in his impending legal battles, including a civil trial where he stands accused of harassing and intimidating the Jane Does from his criminal trial.

This perplexing contradiction raises an array of questions that demand unequivocal answers.

Within the confines of Scientology the memos written by convicted indicted felon L Ron Hubbard delve deeply into the lives of its paying members. 

These individuals are urged, even coerced and including but not limited to even pay to submit themselves to highly invasive "sessions" that pry into them fully and unequivocally incriminating themselves. 

These sessions unequivocally lead to admissions of serious criminal offenses, including but not limited to class A felonies. Astonishingly, these so called "audit sessions/sec checks"  are meticulously video recorded and contemporaneously transcribed, all within the confines of converted hotel rooms.

It's essential to note that these highly irregular, pseudo self-incriminating, and potentially illegal depositions are often conducted by individuals, including minors, who have been groomed to effectively serve as interrogators for including but not limited to self admited FELONS. 

They are, in essence, fully expected and charged with the responsibility of extracting all the self incriminating highly damning information 

Scientology has thrived on this unthinkable practice, which utilizes and exposes minors to both side of the role play as "auditor" and "pc" (i.e DOM/SUB without ability to set a shred of boundary) all while monetizing and data mining the admissions obtained through these rough sessions. 

The organization has wholeheartedly endorsed self-incrimination,  celebrating the vulnerability of its members as a means to secure control and financial gain.

Yet once Scientology itself is placed under any legal scrutiny or called to answer for its actions, it appears they have no qualms about resorting to the fifth amendment – a legal safeguard designed to protect individuals from self-incrimination.

This glaring incongruity raises serious doubts about the organization's integrity and motives. How can they simultaneously champion the pursuit of truth through admissions, only to invoke silence when faced with their own accountability? 

The hypocrisy is staggering and speaks to their willingness to play dumb to manipulate all angles stretching them beyond the point of utter absurdity. 

Scientology's security checks stand exposed for what they truly are – a tool to extract self-incriminating information from their members, all while profiting from their vulnerabilities. 

And today as they are faced with their own responsibility, they hypocritically employ the very tactic they've long criticized in others.

This double standard is not just astounding; it is deeply troubling. 

As we advocate for justice, it's high time to confront this contradiction head-on. 

Y'all cant have it all way every way anyway that is just ridiculous and makes a true mockery of the entire "legal process"

Therefor we demand genuine transparency and accountability, for no one, including Scientology, should be above the law.

Kids Of Scientology 

#Hypocrisy #Scientology #LegalContradictions #PleadTheFifth #Transparency #Justice #Openness

episodes.title: Lori Vallow-Daybell Case Sets Precedent for Accountability in Scientology Parenting?
episodes.description:
BREAKING NEWS:
 Lori Vallow-Daybell Case Sets Precedent for Accountability in Scientology Parenting

The recent sentencing of Lori Vallow-Daybell has sent shockwaves through various communities, raising concerns about the actions of some parents who adhere to controversial beliefs, including those associated with Scientology. Regardless of one's faith or beliefs, the case highlights the importance of accountability and the responsibility parents have to protect and care for their children. The legal consequences faced by Lori Vallow-Daybell, despite her religious affiliations, sets a precedent that transcends any religious ideology and emphasizes the obligation to abide by the law when raising children.

Background of this criminal case:

Lori Vallow-Daybell, a woman associated with the beliefs of the "Prepper" movement and her alleged ties to elements of Scientology, has garnered national attention due to the tragic disappearance and deaths of her two children, Joshua "JJ" Vallow and Tylee Ryan. The case exposed the potential dangers of individuals who prioritize their beliefs over their parental duties, raising concerns about the impact of extremist ideologies on parenting decisions.

Accountability of Parents When it comes to their Kids:

The fundamental principle underlying the case of Lori Vallow-Daybell is that, regardless of religious beliefs, parents are legally and morally obligated to protect their children's well-being and safety. Parenthood comes with a host of responsibilities, and the state has a vested interest in ensuring the welfare of children. The Vallow-Daybell case has illustrated that no matter what religious or philosophical beliefs a parent subscribes to, they must adhere to the law and provide a safe environment for their children.

Setting a Precedent affecting all “Scientology Parents”:

The sentencing of Lori Vallow-Daybell sets a significant precedent, establishing that parents who break the law and fail in their parental duties will be held accountable, regardless of their religious affiliation or ideology. This precedent serves as a reminder that religious freedom does not grant a license to act irresponsibly or endanger the lives of children. The legal system's message is clear: the best interests of the child must always come first, and any violations of this principle will have serious consequences.

Importance of Separating Beliefs from ‘Parenting’:

In any society, religious freedom is an essential tenet, and individuals have the right to hold and practice their beliefs. However, it is crucial to distinguish between the right to belief and the duty of parenting. While parents have the right to pass on their values to their children, it must be done responsibly, with due consideration for the child's safety, well-being, and legal rights.


The Lori Vallow-Daybell case has brought to light the importance of holding parents accountable for their actions, irrespective of their religious beliefs or affiliations. Parenthood is a responsibility that requires putting the best interests of the child first, ensuring their safety, and abiding by the law. The precedent set by this case emphasizes that religious freedom does not exempt parents from their obligations and responsibilities. It serves as a reminder to all parents, regardless of their faith, that they will be held accountable for their actions when it comes to the welfare of their children.

Individuals who have chosen to enable or engage in abusive behavior towards children while claiming to follow the teachings of convicted and indicted in absentia runaway felon “L. Ron Hubbard” must recognize that their actions have legal consequences. 

In such circumstances, they should seek legal representation from CRIMINAL ATTORNEYS to advocate for their defense.

We won’t stop until all minors and senior citizens are safe and away from harms way. 

Serge Del Mar
